Purging the Security Event Log

Depending upon the number of users and the amount of activity on a server configuration, the security event log may grow rapidly. To keep the log a reasonable size, you can have the Server delete old entries.

Decide how many days you want to retain security events, then set the server configuration to purge entries that are older than this.

Note: You can perform this function only on servers that are currently running.

To set the interval for purging the security event log:

  1. Do one of the following:

    • On a computer that has the Server installed, select Start > Programs > StarTeam > StarTeam Server x.x > StarTeam Server.

    • From the client, select Start > Programs > StarTeam > StarTeam client_name > Server Administration from the client (available with custom installations only).

    The Server Administration dialog appears.

  2. Select a server configuration from the left pane.  If you have not yet logged onto the server configuration, you will be asked to do so. If you are using the client, you can administer remote servers only.

  3. From the Server Administration dialog, do one of the following:

    • Click the Accounts bar in the lower left panel. Then click the System Policy shortcut.

    • From the menu, select Tools > Accounts > System Policy.

    The System Policy dialog opens.

  4. Select the Security Events tab.

  5. Select the Purge security event entries older than __ days check box. Clearing this check box keeps the security event entries indefinitely.

  6. Enter a number of days in the text box. The range is 30 to 1000. The default is 180. The next time the server configuration starts, entries that are older than this limit are deleted.

  7. Click OK. You must restart the server configuration for this change to take effect.
